Description: Typical range for industrial laser cleaning systems (e.g., CleanLaser CL 50-500 models) on delicate substrates like quartz glass to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100W for controlled ablation of contaminants. Max safe ~300-500W depending on fluence to prevent cracking (source: IPG Photonics specs and J. Laser Appl. 2018 study on glass cleaning).
Near-IR wavelength with good transmission through Quartz Glass for selective contaminant removal
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with controlled thermal accumulation
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with minimal substrate heating
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap percentage for uniform cleaning coverage
